quotes.quote: A good coach passes on information quickly. They do not hold back information that affects my job.
Coaches are aware of how to ignite passion and motivate people. They have an energy that is contagious and know exactly how to get their team excited.
A coach is someone who tells you what you don't want to hear, who has you see what you don't want to see, so you can be who you have always known you could be.
The Coach does not play in the game, but the Coach helps the players identify areas to improve their game.

Teachers spend most of their daytime hours with children. Teachers at every level, coaches, counselors, cafeteria workers and yes, custodians, spend their hours trying to make children's lives different, if not always better.
A mentor or a coach is often a good source of tough love. This type of person will often keep pushing you to perform at your best, even when you think you can't get any better.
Coaches have to watch for what they don't want to see and listen to what they don't want to hear.
A lot of coaches make it harder than it should be. Some are too hard on themselves, obsessing about controlling everything, not trusting their assistants, worrying about time.
The one thing coaches cannot tolerate... is the individual who grows arrogant because he excelled at a lower level and believes he has nothing else to learn.
As a coach, you need to cultivate an important character trait, which is your desire and passion to help and inspire others.
Leaders empower individuals by building trust and coaching competence in their job roles and networking skills.
We push players beyond their limits and expectations every day. We ask them to take risks. Sometimes, as coaches, we have to remember to do that with our decisions, too.
Coaches will eventually notice a great attitude, and they respect that.

People think that coaches are always right, but it's difficult to teach a runner how to run, because every runner is different. You have to have an understanding of how to assist what that runner has, so they know how to assist what you have without taking away your special ability, because you're not like anybody else.

Coaches do so much research about a referee because they believe refereeing is such a crucial part of the game that the result may hinge on what we say or do. They probably know more about me than I know myself!
A good coach can change a game. A great coach can change a life.

A coach needs to be able to capitalize on his knowledge of the needs, motivations, playing styles, and values of each member on the team. As a coach, you will use your knowledge of these people to meld them into a cohesive unit.
A coach is someone who can give correction without causing resentment.

Every leader is different. Every bench is different. Every business is different. So while the complexities change, the work of coaching stays the same keep your clients at the center of the work, push them to use their strengths more and to temper their weaknesses, and illuminate blind spots because these are what really get in the way
Coaches will do what they can but it doesn't necessarily bother me. You are an international referee for a reason. If things like that are going to ruffle your feathers, don't bother doing the job.

Coaches don't sleep for a reason. They don't sleep because it's a danger zone every night. Very seldom do you ever get two or three days off... The lifestyle of coaching in the NBA is a tremendous challenge that gives you tremendous highs but also tremendous lows.
Coaches who have been players in the league, they get so attuned to playing how they were successful and who their coaches were.

There's a saying in my business that there are two kinds of coaches - those who have been fired and those who haven't been fired yet. That's kind of like prostate cancer. Every man will have it if he lives long enough.
A coach is a leader who is followed willingly, without having to drag people along.
As coaches, any work you may do, it's been done long ago.
A coach should never be afraid to ask questions of anyone he could learn from.
Successful coaches are visionaries. They have a picture of success set in their minds.

The test of a good coach is that when they leave, others will carry on successfully.
Coaches have to watch for what they don't want to see and listen to what they don't want to hear.
Very good coaches for ski jumpers stand at the top of the slope and watch the jumpers prepare, rather than standing at the bottom and watching them land.
Coaches who let a championship team back off from becoming a dynasty are cowards.
As coaches say, it's about finding your role. We're coming together as a team.
Coaches know that a parent publicly scolding his kid after a race will not help the athlete perform better.

Coaches have got to be given rank within the university so that you can't fire a coach unless you go through an academic committee, just as you would with a professor. If coaches are to have any stability and security, they need to be treated like an English professor.
A coach helps and encourages others get results.
What makes a good coach? Complete dedication.
A truly great coach does not tell people that they are a truly great coach.

Coaches in the office do not teach accountants how to balance ledger books, and they do not aim to teach secretaries how to use letter heads - no. Rather, they have a way of beginning a sort of informal conversation between them and the employees, where they get to appreciate the prevailing challenges.
The best coaches really care about people. They have a sincere interest in people.

As coaches, we usually have plenty of changes from one year to the next. Sometimes it seems like it's at one position. Sometimes it's across the board. But this is really a part of every year that we have in coaching in the NFL.
Coaches are an integral part of any manager's team, especially if they are good pinochle players.
Coaches who can outline plays on a black board are a dime a dozen. The ones who win get inside their player and motivate.
Coaches can teach you two things: confidence and technique.
But as coaches, we need to get a little more fire and passion and be more demanding that our guys get the job done. I think players will respond to that, and we'll see.
Good human-relations skills have the ability to change people from managing others to leading others.

A coach can play a number of roles - mentor, consultant, motivator, but one thing she (or he) is not a therapist. Coaching deals with the "how": how you can move on from where you are and make change. It's action-oriented, and concerned with the present and future, not the past.
People always get confused. They talk about coaches. The reality is, these coaches and managers that everybody thinks are in so much control, they work for us. They're our employees.

Coach thinks I can play basketball and still get into college.
A coach who's a has-been doesn't coach champions; he just makes more has-beens.

Coach started paying more attention to Ben; you started paying more attention to Coach. You paid attention to him; Coach paid attention to Ben; Ben's stats kept improving. It's nice how that worked out, isn't it?
The purpose of sports coaching is to improve the performance of an athlete or sports team.
It is important that coaches have an understanding regarding how a mental imagery intervention might help an athlete's performance.
As a coach you will fulfill a number of roles during your coaching practice. Your practice will include a range of styles, behaviours and interactions with participants.
Remember that, however knowledgeable and enthusiastic you are, the effectiveness of your coaching will depend on good planning and sound practice.
Coach is a label liberally applied to categories people who assist individuals or groups in enhancing their performance, fulfilling potential or the achievement of goals.

Sport can contribute positively to the development of individuals, not just physically but also socially and emotionally. This can only happen if sport is in the right hands--those of the informed, thinking and enlightened coach.
Sports coaching develops people through improving their performance.
Coaches can be many things to different people.
More experienced and enlightened coaches recognize they also ave a responsibility towards social, emotional and physical needs and development of their performers.
Coaches come from a variety of backgrounds. They possess a range of different qualities and experiences on which they develop their coaching skills and unique style of coaching.
Coaches were not perceived to be part  of a systematic process for improving performance. Coaching was something for a recreative performer.

Typically, adventure sports coaches are well informed and practiced with respect to the technical aspects of their disciplines but are comparatively naive about coaching adventure sports as a discipline.
The coach should be knowledgeable of the technical and tactical requirements of their sport, and be able to provide effective and accurate demonstration.
A further skill that the coach needs to develop is the ability to observe, monitor and accurately assess performance in training and competition.
The coach is required to conduct sessions in a safe environment, and they should be aware of all health and safety considerations.
If the coach can get into good habits in the early stages of their career, it will facilitate their development.
The sport coach needs to understand how to integrate all these pressures into practice in a matter that allows athletes to perform at their best during competition.
It is clear that coaches and significant others play an important role at every stage.
Coaches are playing an increasingly important and diverse role in sport and the community.
Coaches are also engaging with a broader range of participants who place significantly greater demands on them.
We know that great coaches often analyse themselves to seek better ways to coach.

Coaching is about striving to contribute to the success of each athlete.

Becoming a great coach is an ongoing process. Coaches abilities are diverse and complex and each coach is at a different development level.

As players, we put our trust in coaches at a very early age. They teach us the game and they help us through school. They give us advice on life. Sometimes, they even hold our dreams in their hands.
